SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Shelf

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Shelf
public class Shelf extends Object
Shelf is a class that represents the shelf of a player It contains a matrix of items and a list of insertable columns

  • Constructor Details

    • Shelf

      public Shelf()
      Constructs a new Shelf object. Initializes the items array with null values for each slot. Initializes the insertableColumns list as an empty list.

  • Method Details

    • clone

      public Shelf clone()
      clone creates a copy of the shelf
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a clone of the shelf

    • clear

      public void clear()
      clear empties the shelf setting all the items to null

    • getItems

      public Item[][] getItems()
      getItems is used to get a group of items from the shelf
      Returns:
      a matrix of items

    • setItems

      public void setItems(Item[][] items)
      setItems sets on the shelf a matrix of items Must be used only for testing purposes
      Parameters:
      items - : matrix of items to be set

    • insertItems

      public void insertItems(List<Item> insertableItems, int Column)
      insertItems inserts a list of items in a specific column of the shelf
      Parameters:
      insertableItems - : list of items to be inserted
      Column - : column where the items will be inserted

    • insertItem

      public void insertItem(Item item, int column)
      insertItem is the same as the previous one, but it inserts only one item(used for testing)
      Parameters:
      item - : item to be inserted
      column - : column where the item will be inserted

    • setInsertableColumns

      public void setInsertableColumns(int numItems)
      setInsertableColumns sets a list called "insertableColumns", which contains the columns where it is possible to insert a certain number of items
      Parameters:
      numItems - : number of items to be inserted

    • setInsertableColumns

      public void setInsertableColumns(int[] cols)
      Sets the columns where it is possible to insert items
      Parameters:
      cols - is an array of insertablecolumns

    • getInsertableColumns

      public List<Integer> getInsertableColumns()
      getInsertableColumns gives back the list created by the previous method
      Returns:
      the list "insertableColumns", that contains the columns where it is possible to insert a certain number of items
      See Also:
      • setInsertableColumns(int)

    • getMaxFreeSpace

      public int getMaxFreeSpace()
      getMaxFreeSpace checks row by row, what is the maximum number of free spaces in a column of the shelf; then it compares this number with 3
      Returns:
      this number if it is less than 3, otherwise it returns 3

    • setMaxFreeSpace

      public void setMaxFreeSpace(int n)
      dummy method, just to make the ObjectMapper work
      Parameters:
      n - whatever the json gives me

    • setItem

      public void setItem(int x, int y, Item item)
      setItem sets an item in a certain position (x, y) of the shelf
      Parameters:
      x - : column
      y - : row
      item - : item to be inserted

    • getItem

      public Item getItem(int x, int y)
      getItem gives back the item in a certain position of the shelf
      Parameters:
      x - : column
      y - : row
      Returns:
      the item in the position (x, y) of the shelf

    • getColumns

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Item>> getColumns()
      getColumns creates a List of columns, where each column is a List of items
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ArrayLists of items, where each ArrayList contains the items of a column

    • getRows

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Item>> getRows()
      getRows creates a List of rows, where each row is a List of items
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ArrayLists of items, where each ArrayList contains the items of a row

    • adjacent

      public int adjacent(int x, int y, Type type)
      adjacent analyzes the items of the shelf and counts how many items of a certain type are adjacent to each other
      Parameters:
      x - : column
      y - : row
      type - : type of the items to be analyzed
      Returns:
      the number of adjacent items of a certain type

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString it's used to have a representation of the shelf as a string
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the shelf, showing the items present on each position.

    • columnsToString

      public String columnsToString(int choice)
      columnsToString creates a string that represents the columns of the shelf
      Parameters:
      choice - the selected column
      Returns:
      the string representation of the insertable columns, with a special symbol for the selected column.
